t: Lamentations 5
Restore Us to Yourself, O Lord
Remember,*pn O Lord,*s what has befallen us; look,*ld and see our disgrace!
Our*ln inheritance has been turned over to strangers, our*ld homes to foreigners.
We*ln have become orphans, fatherless; our*ld mothers are like widows.
We*ln must pay for the water we drink; the*ld wood we get must be bought.
Our*ln pursuers are at our necks; we*ld are weary; we are given no rest.
We*ln have given the hand to Egypt, and to Assyria, to*ld get bread enough.
Our*ln fathers sinned, and are no more; and*ld we bear their iniquities.
Slaves*ln rule over us; there*ld is none to deliver us from their hand.
We*ln get our bread at the peril of our lives, because*ld of the sword in the wilderness.
Our*ln skin is hot as an oven with*ld the burning heat of famine.
Women*ln are raped in Zion, young*ld women in the towns of Judah.
Princes*ln are hung up by their hands; no*ld respect is shown to the elders.
Young*ln men are compelled to grind at the mill, and*ld boys stagger under loads of wood.
The*ln old men have left the city gate, the*ld young men their music.
The*ln joy of our hearts has ceased; our*ld dancing has been turned to mourning.
The*ln crown has fallen from our head; woe*ld to us, for we have sinned!
For*ln this our heart has become sick, for*ld these things our eyes have grown dim,
for*ln Mount Zion which lies desolate; jackals*ld prowl over it.
But*ln you, O Lord,*s reign forever; your*ld throne endures to all generations.
Why*ln do you forget us forever, why*ld do you forsake us for so many days?
Restore*ln us to yourself, O Lord,*s that we may be restored! Renew*ld our days as of oldâ€”
unless*ln you have utterly rejected us, and*ld you remain exceedingly angry with us.
